availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Nicholas County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Susan Evans Brooks in Nicholas County, Kentucky, in November 1843. Father of Anne E. Brooks, Nathan A. Brooks, Eveline Brooks, Sarah E. Brooks, William F. Brooks, Elmira F. Brooks, and Mary L. Brooks. Farmer in Nicholas County in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Nicholas County in 1850. Farmer in Nicholas County in 1860. Employed John J. Brooks as a farm laborer in Nicholas County in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Nicholas County in 1860.

Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Nicholas County Marriages, Film 000252404.
Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989, Kentucky County, District, and Probate Courts, Nicholas County Executors Bonds, October-1889, p. 321.
